segment.source: Add Production Devices to the Membership Group for a Zone (Windows 10)
segment.target: Add Production Devices to the Membership Group for a Zone (Windows 10)

segment.source: Add Production Devices to the Membership Group for a Zone
segment.target: Add Production Devices to the Membership Group for a Zone

segment.source: Add Production Devices to the Membership Group for a Zone
segment.target: Add Production Devices to the Membership Group for a Zone

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: After you test the GPOs for your design on a small set of devices, you can deploy them to the production devices.
segment.target: After you test the GPOs for your design on a small set of devices, you can deploy them to the production devices.

segment.source: Caution
segment.target: Caution

segment.source: For GPOs that contain connection security rules that prevent unauthenticated connections, be sure to set the rules to request, not require, authentication during testing.
segment.target: For GPOs that contain connection security rules that prevent unauthenticated connections, be sure to set the rules to request, not require, authentication during testing.

segment.source: After you deploy the GPO and confirm that all of your devices are successfully communicating by using authenticated IPsec, then you can modify the GPO to require authentication.
segment.target: After you deploy the GPO and confirm that all of your devices are successfully communicating by using authenticated IPsec, then you can modify the GPO to require authentication.

segment.source: Do not change the boundary zone GPO to require mode.
segment.target: Do not change the boundary zone GPO to require mode.

segment.source: The method discussed in this guide uses the Domain Computers built-in group.
segment.target: The method discussed in this guide uses the Domain Computers built-in group.

segment.source: The advantage of this method is that all new devices that are joined to the domain automatically receive the isolated domain GPO.
segment.target: The advantage of this method is that all new devices that are joined to the domain automatically receive the isolated domain GPO.

segment.source: To do this successfully, you must make sure that the WMI filters and security group filters exclude devices that must not receive the GPOs.
segment.target: To do this successfully, you must make sure that the WMI filters and security group filters exclude devices that must not receive the GPOs.

segment.source: Use device groups that deny both read and apply Group Policy permissions to the GPOs, such as a group used in the CGDOMISONOIPSEC example design.
segment.target: Use device groups that deny both read and apply Group Policy permissions to the GPOs, such as a group used in the CGDOMISONOIPSEC example design.

segment.source: Devices that are members of some zones must also be excluded from applying the GPOs for the main isolated domain.
segment.target: Devices that are members of some zones must also be excluded from applying the GPOs for the main isolated domain.

segment.source: For more information, see the "Prevent members of a group from applying a GPO" section in Assign Security Group Filters to the GPO.
segment.target: For more information, see the "Prevent members of a group from applying a GPO" section in Assign Security Group Filters to the GPO.

segment.source: Without such a group (or groups), you must either add devices individually or use the groups containing device accounts that are available to you.
segment.target: Without such a group (or groups), you must either add devices individually or use the groups containing device accounts that are available to you.

segment.source: Administrative credentials
segment.target: Administrative credentials

segment.source: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the membership of the group for the GPO.
segment.target: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the membership of the group for the GPO.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Add the group Domain Devices to the GPO membership group
segment.target: Add the group Domain Devices to the GPO membership group

segment.source: Refresh Group Policy on the devices in the membership group
segment.target: Refresh Group Policy on the devices in the membership group

segment.source: Check which GPOs apply to a device
segment.target: Check which GPOs apply to a device

segment.source: To add domain devices to the GPO membership group
segment.target: To add domain devices to the GPO membership group

segment.source: Open Active Directory Users and Computers.
segment.target: Open Active Directory Users and Computers.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, expand Active Directory Users and Computers, expand YourDomainName, and then the container in which you created the membership group.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, expand Active Directory Users and Computers, expand YourDomainName, and then the container in which you created the membership group.

segment.source: In the details pane, double-click the GPO membership group to which you want to add computers.
segment.target: In the details pane, double-click the GPO membership group to which you want to add computers.

segment.source: Select the Members tab, and then click Add.
segment.target: Select the Members tab, and then click Add.

segment.source: Type Domain Computers in the text box, and then click OK.
segment.target: Type Domain Computers in the text box, and then click OK.

segment.source: Click OK to close the group properties dialog box.
segment.target: Click OK to close the group properties dialog box.

segment.source: After a computer is a member of the group, you can force a Group Policy refresh on the computer.
segment.target: After a computer is a member of the group, you can force a Group Policy refresh on the computer.

segment.source: To refresh Group Policy on a device
segment.target: To refresh Group Policy on a device

segment.source: From an elevated command prompt, type the following:
segment.target: From an elevated command prompt, type the following:

segment.source: After Group Policy is refreshed, you can see which GPOs are currently applied to the computer.
segment.target: After Group Policy is refreshed, you can see which GPOs are currently applied to the computer.
